I remember buying the game 7 years ago for 40 euros. At this moment +500 hours on it. What a mess they have made out of this... The pve is the biggest boring joke in history. Think everyone can play it with their eyes closed and you would have more fun.

Initially thought to write a big review on this thing, but I'm not going to spend these minutes on typing it. Just find some other games to play, like Deep Rock Galactic. Dive into some good old stuff like Morrowind or get yourself fighting in a fun indie game Thronefall!
Blizzard made EA and Ubisoft look like nice and consumer friendly company.

Downloaded so I could leave my share of review as a player since release way back in 2016;
Game was booming from 2016 - 2019 where they took a break to work on absolutely nothing up to 2022, that's 3 years of fuck-all that Blizzard developers went on to do up until they said Overwatch 2 PVE would release a year after Overwatch 2 PVP, to which they later announced they scrapped the plans.

Bear in mind I've played this game for 7 years now, I've even had my share of competitive experiences through Path to Pro competing in Open Division. Developers had long neglected ranked queue as players pay for boosts and are matched in an inappropriate rank pool. Scrimming was the only viable way to play the game because of the nature of how this game DEMANDS teamwork but that's whatever, if you're a good player you would climb anyways so whatever.

The problem was that post Brigitte-release, developers were lost and did not know how to balance the game, they came up with the bullshit that is the balancing patch that imo should've been called Overwatch 1.2 at best and they took 3 years to release Sojourn and called it a day while they attempt to revive plans for PVE in a hurry, only to announce that it was cancelled because they couldn't do it. In that 3 years we got absolutely NOTHING for content, no PVE, no new event modes, no buffs/nerfs to balance gameplay.

For me, it was the dishonesty and how apparent it was that the developers had already given up on the game, even in their developer updates they sounded depressed and defeated about where the game was headed. How are the players supposed to stay hopeful for a game whose developers have already given up on? You tell me...
